page.title: 19CHILDRENS ATTITUDES,S.LEEDS
page.content: We asked a number of thirteen year olds about their attitudes to living in the Hunslet area. Many of them said they found living in Hunslet very dull, as there are very few leisure activities in the area apart from the Athletic centre at Jack Lane.Other than that they have to go to South Leeds Sports Centre for weight training,swimming,judo or badminton or into the City Centre for cinimas or large shops. Two of the people we spoke to have been in trouble with the police.They found life so boring that they had committed minor acts of vandalism. Some children had plans for the future.3 would like to enter the armed services,and 4 want to go on to further education.Most feel very depressed about the future and feel most of them will be unemployed.
